documentation.text: @dev modifier allowing function to be only called through the hub
@dev modifier allowing function to be only called by the token owner

@notice helper function for block timestamp
 @return the block timestamp

@notice helper function for fetching the period length from the hub
 @return period length in seconds

@notice helper function for fetching the number of periods from the hub
 @return the number of periods since the hub was deployed

@notice helper function for fetching the timeout from the hub
 @return the number of seconds the token can go without being updated before it's deactivated

@notice helper functio for getting the hub deployment time
 @return the timestamp the hub was deployed at

@notice Caution! manually deactivates or stops this token, no ubi will be payed out after this is called
 @dev intended for use in case of key loss, system failure, or migration to new contracts

@notice receive a ubi payout
 @dev this is the method to actually update storage with new token balance

attributes.text: @dev modifier allowing function to be only called through the hub
@dev modifier allowing function to be only called by the token owner

@notice helper function for block timestamp
 @return the block timestamp

@notice helper function for fetching the period length from the hub
 @return period length in seconds

@notice helper function for fetching the number of periods from the hub
 @return the number of periods since the hub was deployed

@notice helper function for fetching the timeout from the hub
 @return the number of seconds the token can go without being updated before it's deactivated

@notice helper functio for getting the hub deployment time
 @return the timestamp the hub was deployed at

@notice Caution! manually deactivates or stops this token, no ubi will be payed out after this is called
 @dev intended for use in case of key loss, system failure, or migration to new contracts

@notice receive a ubi payout
 @dev this is the method to actually update storage with new token balance

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

findInflationOffset().details: ubi is payed out continuously between inflation steps

returns._0: the amount of seconds until the next inflation step
the timestamp the hub was deployed at

params.amount: the amount of tokens to transfer
params.from: the address the tokens are being transferred from
params.to: the address the tokens are being transferred to

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

look().details: is called in the update method to write the new balance to state, but also useful in wallets

returns._0: how much ubi this token holder is owed

name().details: all circles tokens should have the same name

returns._0: the number of periods since the hub was deployed

periodsWhenLastTouched().details: ie. if ubi was last payed out during the second inflation step, returns two

stop().details: intended for use in case of key loss, system failure, or migration to new contracts

stopped().details: combines the manual stop variable with a dead man's switch

returns._0: false is the token is still paying out ubi, otherwise true

symbol().details: all circles tokens should have the same symbol

returns._0: the number of seconds the token can go without being updated before it's deactivated

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}; Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

update().details: this is the method to actually update storage with new token balance

decimals.details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

findInflationOffset().notice: the amount of seconds until the ubi payout is next inflated

hubDeployedAt().notice: helper functio for getting the hub deployment time

hubTransfer(address,address,uint256).notice: special method called by the hub to execute a transitive transaction

look().notice: checks how much ubi this token holder is owed, but doesn't update their balance

name().notice: helper function for the token name

period().notice: helper function for fetching the period length from the hub

periods().notice: helper function for fetching the number of periods from the hub

periodsWhenLastTouched().notice: find the inflation step when ubi was last payed out

stop().notice: Caution! manually deactivates or stops this token, no ubi will be payed out after this is called

stopped().notice: checks whether this token has been either stopped manually, or whether it has timed out

symbol().notice: helper function for the token symbol

timeout().notice: helper function for fetching the timeout from the hub
